data.title: President Rutherford B. Hayes Congratulates Queen Victoria on the
data.meta_description: Sold for $656 | Partly-printed DS as president, signed “R. B. Hayes,” one page, 7.75 x 9.75, November 15, 1878. President Hayes directs the
data.text:
Description

President Hayes sends a congratulatory letter to "the Queen of England upon the birth of a Grand Child"

Partly-printed DS as president, signed “R. B. Hayes,” one page, 7.75 x 9.75, November 15, 1878. President Hayes directs the Secretary of State to “affix the Seal of the United States to an envelope containing a congratulatory letter addressed to the Queen of England upon the birth of a Grand Child.” Signed neatly at the conclusion by Rutherford B. Hayes. Affixed by its left edge to the inside of a presentation folder and in fine condition.

President Hayes sent this letter of congratulations in response to the birth of Princess Alexandra of Saxe-Coburg and Gotha (1878-1942), the fourth child and third daughter of Alfred, Duke of Saxe-Coburg and Gotha, and Grand Duchess Maria Alexandrovna of Russia. Alfred, known as the Duke of Edinburgh from 1866 until he succeeded his paternal uncle Ernest II as the reigning Duke of Saxe-Coburg and Gotha in the German Empire, was the second son and fourth child of Queen Victoria and Prince Albert. Princess Alexandra was one of Queen Victoria’s 42 grandchildren.
